  • Constructor Details

    • Terminal

      public Terminal()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method that runs the program

      Parameters:
      args -

    • resetStyle

      public void resetStyle()
      Reset printing rules in effect to terminal defaults.

      Reset the color, background color, and any other style (i.e.: underlined, dim, bright) to the terminal defaults.

    • clearScreen

      public void clearScreen()
      Clear the whole screen.

      Might reset cursor position.

    • moveTo

      public void moveTo​(java.lang.Integer x, java.lang.Integer y)
      Move cursor to the given position.

      Positions are counted from one. Cursor position 1,1 is at the top left corner of the screen.

      Parameters:
      x - Column number.
      y - Row number.

    • setColor

      public void setColor​(Color color)
      Set the foreground printing color.

      Already printed text is not affected.

      Parameters:
      color - The color to set.

    • setBgColor

      public void setBgColor​(Color color)
      Set the background printing color.

      Already printed text is not affected.

      Parameters:
      color - The background color to set.

    • setUnderline

      public void setUnderline()
      Make printed text underlined.

      On some terminals this might produce slanted text instead of underlined. Cannot be turned off without turning off colors as well.

    • setCursorPosition

      public void setCursorPosition​(Direction direction, java.lang.Integer amount)
      Move the cursor relatively.

      Move the cursor amount from its current position in the given direction.

      Parameters:
      direction - Step the cursor in this direction.
      amount - Step the cursor this many times.

    • setChar

      public void setChar​(char c)
      Set the character diplayed under the current cursor position.

      The actual cursor position after calling this method is the same as beforehand. This method is useful for drawing shapes (for example frame borders) with cursor movement.

      Parameters:
      c - the literal character to set for the current cursor position.

    • setGlyph

      public char setGlyph()
      Set special character

      Setting a special character to be printed

      Returns:
      special char

    • setCursorPosition

      public void setCursorPosition()
      Set cursor position

      User is asked to enter two x and y position The cursor is set to that position using moveTo function
